SENT.plain: A 4-year-old boy was diagnosed as suffering from Burkitt's lymphoma with abdominal and maxillary involvement
The child was from a nonendemic area for Burkitt's lymphoma, and no association with Epstein-Barr virus was found
Two years after the completion of therapy, (3.25 years later) the child developed a solitary brain tumor, which was completely excised and was diagnosed as Burkitt's lymphoma
Very late relapse in nonendemic Burkitt's lymphoma is very rare, and its presentation as a solid brain mass without meningeal involvement has not been reported before
